title: Sugar industry influenced researchers and blamed fat for CVD (2016)

title: The first commercial space stations will start orbiting Earth in 2026
summary: For nearly three decades, the International Space Station has been the only destination in low Earth orbit, but that will change this year. Could it be the start of a thriving economy in space?

title: اقتصاد البحرين ينمو 4% في الربع الثالث 2025
summary: نما الناتج المحلي الإجمالي لمملكة البحرين بنسبة 4 بالمئة بالأسعار الثابتة وبنسبة 4.5 بالمئة بالأسعار الجارية خلال الربع الثالث من عام 2025 على أساس سنوي، بحسب ما أظهرت تقديرات الحسابات القومية الصادرة عن هيئة المعلومات والحكومة الإلكترونية.

title: A strange kind of quantumness may be key to quantum computers' success
summary: Researchers at Google have used their Willow quantum computer to demonstrate that "quantum contextuality" may be a crucial ingredient for its computational prowess

title: The best new science fiction books of January 2026
summary: Big hitter Peter F. Hamilton has a new sci-fi novel out this month – and Booker winner George Saunders ventures into speculative fiction with his latest book, Vigil

title: Gargantuan black hole may be a remnant from the dawn of the universe
summary: Astronomers were puzzled by a black hole around 50 million times the mass of the sun with no stars, spotted by the James Webb Space Telescope – now simulations suggest it could be a primordial black hole, something we have never seen before

title: The challenges of writing from the perspective of a sex robot
summary: The author of the award-winning science fiction novel Annie Bot, the January read for the New Scientist Book Club, on how she created her startling protagonist

title: Read an extract from Annie Bot by Sierra Greer
summary: In this extract from the award-winning science fiction novel Annie Bot, the January read for the New Scientist Book Club, we are introduced to Sierra Greer's protagonist, a sex robot called Annie

title: Rare Saturn-sized rogue planet is first to have its mass measured
summary: Researchers have confirmed the mass of a free-floating planet thanks to a lucky convergence of ground- and space-based telescopes

title: مصر توقع عقد تمويل مجمع إنتاج السيليكون المعدني
summary: شهد وزير البترول والثروة المعدنية المصري المهندس كريم بدوي، توقيع عقد تمويل مشترك طويل الأجل بقيمة 140 مليون دولار؛ لتنفيذ المرحلة الأولى من مجمع إنتاج السيليكون المعدني ومشتقاته، أحد مشروعات الشركة المصرية القابضة للبتروكيماويات، والمقرر إقامته بالمنطقة الصناعية في العلمين الجديدة.

title: The duo kite-skiing 4000 kilometres across Antarctica for science
summary: An explorer and a glaciologist are kite-skiing across Antarctica with a ground-penetrating radar to gather data that will help understand the past and future of the ice sheet

title: Controversial satellites launching in 2026 will reflect light to Earth
summary: Reflect Orbital plans to launch thousands of reflective mirrors to produce "sunlight on demand", but researchers are sceptical about whether the reflected light will be enough to generate electricity

title: 2026 Mars mission will set out to solve the mystery of its moons
summary: The Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency will be launching the Martian Moons eXploration mission next year, which should finally tell us how Mars acquired the moons Phobos and Deimos

title: Why stroking seedlings can help them grow big and strong
summary: The science behind why stroking your seedlings actually works. If you’re worried about your seedlings getting long and leggy, try a bit of home thigmomorphogenesis, advises James Wong

title: The best new popular science books of 2026
summary: Clear out your shelves for a bumper new crop of books by authors including Naomi Klein, Rebecca Solnit and Xand Van Tulleken, says culture editor Alison Flood

title: The world’s first fully 3D-printed microscope went big in 2025
summary: A microscope that cost less than £50 and took under 3 hours to build using a common 3D printer could be transformative for students and researchers with limited funding

title: Can a new book crack one of neuroscience's hardest problems? Not quite
summary: The ideas presented in George Lakoff and Srini Narayanan's The Neural Mind are fascinating, but the writing is far less compelling

title: Why it is important to make space for solitude over the festive season
summary: The festive season is a period of social connection for many of us, but alone time can be equally enriching, says Thuy-vy Nguyen, principal investigator of the Solitude Lab

title: Bill Bryson on why he has updated A Short History of Nearly Everything
summary: With the human family tree now more like a hedge and twice as many known moons, Bill Bryson talks to the New Scientist podcast about refreshing his 2003 bestselling book on science

title: The best space pictures of 2025, from supernovae to moon landings
summary: The year’s most memorable moments from astronomy and space exploration include a double-detonating supernova, a private moon landing and a stunning lunar eclipse

title: Gene therapy for Huntington’s disease showed great promise in 2025
summary: An experimental gene therapy seems to slow the progression of Huntington’s disease by about 75 per cent, and researchers are working to make its complicated delivery much more practical

title: You can upgrade your immune system, but not in the way you think
summary: From vitamin C to your microbiome and mindset, the latest science of immunity is often counterintuitive. Here's how to give your system a fighting chance to overcome infection

title: Putting data centres in space isn't going to happen any time soon
summary: From massive solar panels to the difficulty of staying cool - not to mention high-energy radiation - there are a lot of engineering problems that need to be solved before we can build data centres in space
